meanings.definition: A whip or lash made of hide or leather.
meanings.sent1: The tambacs cracked loudly as the rider urged the horse forward.
meanings.sent2: He used the tambacs to guide the cattle in the right direction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog mistook the tambacs for a toy and started playing with it.
meanings.sent4: Her words stung like a tambacs, leaving him feeling hurt and ashamed.
meanings.sent5: The tambacs swished through the air, ready to discipline any disobedient animal.

meanings.definition: To beat or strike with a whip or lash.
meanings.sent1: The cruel taskmaster would tambacs the workers who did not meet their quotas.
meanings.sent2: She had to tambacs the rug to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to tambacs the cream to make it fluffy for the dessert.
meanings.sent4: The storm tambacsed the trees, causing branches to fall all around.
meanings.sent5: He tambacsed the drum with such force that the sound echoed through the room.
